pullRequest.body:
and redefine homogeneous ideal as a homogeneous submodule

rename `SetLike.Homogeneous` to `SetLike.IsHomogeneousElem`
introduced `DirectSum.SetLike.Homogeneous` to mean a set $S$ is homogeneous iff for all $s \in S$, all of its projection $s_i \in S$ as well.

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [ec5e6b8427](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18728/commits/ec5e6b84276e611454af2fc677c89a5b2e29a1fa)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

|<details><summary>6 files</summary> `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.ProjectiveSpectrum.Basic` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.ProjectiveSpectrum.Proper` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.ProjectiveSpectrum.Scheme` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.ProjectiveSpectrum.StructureSheaf` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.ProjectiveSpectrum.Topology` `Mathlib.RingTheory.GradedAlgebra.Radical`</details>|2|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.GradedAlgebra.Homogeneous.Submodule` (new file)|996|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.GradedAlgebra.Homogeneous.Ideal`|1047|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AddSubmonoidClass.IsHomogeneous.mem_iff`

`+ HomogeneousSubmodule.isHomogeneous`
`+ HomogeneousSubmodule.mem_toSubmodule_iff`
`+ HomogeneousSubmodule.setLike`

`+ SetLike.IsHomogeneous`
`+ SetLike.IsHomogeneousElem`
`+ SetLike.IsHomogeneousElem.graded_smul`
`+ SetLike.IsHomogeneousElem.mul`
`+ SetLike.isHomogeneousElem_coe`
`+ SetLike.isHomogeneousElem_one`
`+ Submodule.IsHomogeneous`
`+ Submodule.IsHomogeneous.mem_iff`
`+ instance (x : ProjectiveSpectrum ùíú) : Ideal.IsPrime x.asHomogeneousIdeal.toIdeal := x.isPrime`
`+ instance : AddSubmonoidClass (HomogeneousSubmodule ùíú ‚Ñ≥) M`
`+ instance : SMulMemClass (HomogeneousSubmodule ùíú ‚Ñ≥) A M`
`+ instance : SetLike (HomogeneousSubmodule ùíú ‚Ñ≥) M`
`+ that`
`- SetLike.Homogeneous`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thanks!

bors r+

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13242168071/job/36959798311)
Canceled.

Ah, looks like you fixed the build already:
bors r+
Just in case:
bors d+

:v: jjaassoonn can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13247223366/job/36976583112)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13247223366/job/36976582866)

LGTM
Will wait if @eric-wieser wants to give a final look.

LGTM
Will wait if @eric-wieser wants to give a final look.

```suggestion
the module. However, most interesting properties of homogeneous submodules do rely on the base ring
```

```suggestion
being a graded ring. For technical reasons, we make `HomogeneousSubmodule` depend on a graded ring.
```

```suggestion
instance that `HomogeneousSubmodule` is a complete lattice cannot be synthesized due to
```

```suggestion
  of `m` are in `p`. -/
```
Isn't \mapsto the mathlib style?
indeed
This is interesting, does this have better defeq now?
Is this instance in a later PR? This sounds fishy to me.
Please see here https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/eafe2d1658e5cf8bf32ed0c94c99b3bbb30d51e7/Mathlib/RingTheory/GradedAlgebra/Homogeneous/Submodule.lean#L389
This is #9820, right?

So far I think the crux is that `Submodule.smul_homogeneous_element_mem_of_mem` currently needs a choice of `ùíú` for the proof to go through. Is it really the case that the lattice structure is only well-formed if the ring is graded?
Let me investigate

I think yes? Consider $M := A[X, Y]$ over $A[X]$. So the complete lattice is based on the claim that if $S \subseteq M$ is a set of homogeneous element, then span of $S$ is a homogeneous submodule. Suppose only $M$ has a grading $\deg X = \deg Y = 1$ and every element in $A[X]$ has degree $0$. Then $XY \in M$ is homogeneous, but its span is not homogeneous because $(Y + 1) \cdot XY$ is in the span? Does this work?

I wonder if this makes sense as
```suggestion
def AddSubmonoidClass.IsHomogeneous (p : œÉM) (‚Ñ≥ : ŒπM ‚Üí œÉM)
    [DecidableEq ŒπM] [SetLike œÉM M] [AddSubmonoidClass œÉM M] [Decomposition ‚Ñ≥] : Prop :=
  ‚àÄ (i : ŒπM) ‚¶Ém : M‚¶Ñ, m ‚àà p ‚Üí (DirectSum.decompose ‚Ñ≥ m i : M) ‚àà p
```
Let me try

If we make this change, i.e.
```lean
/-- An `p : Submodule A M` is homogeneous if for every `m ‚àà p`, all homogeneous components
  of `m` are in `p`. -/
def AddSubmonoidClass.IsHomogeneous (‚Ñ≥ : ŒπM ‚Üí œÉM) (p : œÉM)
    [DecidableEq ŒπM] [SetLike œÉM M] [AddSubmonoidClass œÉM M] [Decomposition ‚Ñ≥] : Prop :=
  ‚àÄ (i : ŒπM) ‚¶Ém : M‚¶Ñ, m ‚àà p ‚Üí (DirectSum.decompose ‚Ñ≥ m i : M) ‚àà p
```
in `HomogeneousSubmodule`, 
```lean
structure HomogeneousSubmodule (ùíú : ŒπA ‚Üí œÉA) (‚Ñ≥ : ŒπM ‚Üí œÉM)
    [DecidableEq ŒπA] [AddMonoid ŒπA] [SetLike œÉA A] [AddSubmonoidClass œÉA A] [GradedRing ùíú]
    [DecidableEq ŒπM] [SetLike œÉM M] [AddSubmonoidClass œÉM M] [Decomposition ‚Ñ≥]
    [VAdd ŒπA ŒπM] [GradedSMul ùíú ‚Ñ≥]
    extends Submodule A M where
  is_homogeneous' : AddSubmonoidClass.IsHomogeneous ‚Ñ≥ toSubmodule
```
would not type check because `toSubmodule` is not of type `œÉM`, so we need to specialize ` (‚Ñ≥ : ŒπM ‚Üí Submodule A M)` here
Yes, it's fine to specialize `HomogeneousSubmodule`

But then the downstream `Ideal.IsHomogeneous` need to be changed as well.
```lean

variable [Semiring A]
variable [SetLike œÉ A] [AddSubmonoidClass œÉ A] (ùíú : Œπ ‚Üí œÉ)
variable [DecidableEq Œπ] [AddMonoid Œπ] [GradedRing ùíú]
variable (I : Ideal A)

/-- An `I : Ideal A` is homogeneous if for every `r ‚àà I`, all homogeneous components
  of `r` are in `I`. -/
def Ideal.IsHomogeneous : Prop := AddSubmonoidClass.IsHomogeneous ùíú I
```
for now `Ideal` is not `œÉ`. Not sure if this is direction we want

```lean
def SetLike.IsHomogeneous {P : Type*} [SetLike P M]
    (‚Ñ≥ : ŒπM ‚Üí œÉM) (p : P)
    [DecidableEq ŒπM] [SetLike œÉM M] [Decomposition ‚Ñ≥] : Prop :=
  ‚àÄ (i : ŒπM) ‚¶Ém : M‚¶Ñ, m ‚àà p ‚Üí (DirectSum.decompose ‚Ñ≥ m i : M) ‚àà p
```
Maybe this is better? (perhaps change `SetLike.Homogeneous` to `SetLike.isHomogeneousElement`)
Do we want `AddSubmonoidClass` and `SMulMemClass` on this?
Yes, these two are required in `DirectSum.Decomposition`
I meant `SMulMemClass (HomogeneousSubmodule ùíú ‚Ñ≥) A M`, which I don't think is present in the current PR?
done

```suggestion
theorem HomogeneousSubmodule.mem_toSubmodule_iff {I : HomogeneousSubmodule ùíú ‚Ñ≥} {x : M} :
```

It is not possible to add deprecation aliases because something else took the name, but can you add the aliases for the rest of the theorems (if applicable) and document this rename in the PR message? Thanks!
done

```suggestion
instance (x : ProjectiveSpectrum ùíú) : Ideal.IsPrime x.asHomogeneousIdeal.toIdeal := x.isPrime
```
Does this not work?
Do you want this to be an abbrev? It seems strange that this is a `def` while `HomogeneousIdeal` is an abbrev.
good point changed

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/GradedAlgebra): define homogeneous submodule
